Posts.Content: Hi Allylou, I've read your post and thought it may help if you call our free Macmillan Support Line on 0808 808 00 00 and speak to one of Macmillan nurses. They should be able to answer your question and give some more information how to deal with side effects of the treatment. Best wishes, Macmillan Community Team
Posts.Title: Can you have to much water?

Posts.Content: Good evening all Can I please remind you of the Community Guidelines about seeking personal details from members and posting personal details on the site is against our Community Guidelines. We do not recommend that you ask for or publish your own real name, social media profiles, phone number or address. Many thanks Sandra Macmillan Community Team
Posts.Title: Writing project instead of a blog? July-Dec? Posting here & in the...

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha Rose, I felt so sorry while reading it. It must have been so humiliating and upsetting ;( If you need to talk to anyone about this experience, please call us on 0808 808 00 00. I hope the next sessions will be less unpleasant. Best wishes, Macmillan Community Team
Posts.Title: Positive to negative

Posts.Content: Hi Debbie, I am so sorry to hear about your diagnosis. Maybe it will help if you cal our free Macmillan Support Line on 0808 808 00 00 and speak to one of our Macmillan nurses about salpingo-oophorectomy. Best wishes, Macmillan Community Team
Posts.Title: Brca1 gene

Posts.Content: Hi Coastal-lady I'm sorry to hear about what you're going through during treatment. One of our Experts (Harpreet, a pharmacist) has answered a previous question about turmeric, and says there is no solid evidence that turmeric can prevent or aid cancer treatment. She also linked to some further information from Cancer Research UK but it sounds like you may have already read that. Our team of experts on the Macmillan Support Line can provide support and information to you as well and may be able to help with your specific difficulties around aches and pains. They are available to talk from Monday to Fridays from 9am - 8pm on 0808 808 0000 (calls are free in the UK). You can also ask our nurses on the community if you would prefer to speak to someone online. Best wishes, Rachel Macmillan Community Team
